intro: Fumaria bifrons, commonly known as the common glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Fumaria bifrons is known for its early spring blooming habit, often appearing before the leaves fully develop.
